description: Asserts that the model can make a sequence of function calls in the correct order and conveys the results to the user
prompt: Call funcA with 1, then call funcB with 2, then respond with the results of both calls

expected_function_calls.name: funcA
expected_function_calls.result: This is the output of funcA(1)

expected_function_calls.name: funcB
expected_function_calls.result: This is the output of funcB(2)

final_answer_should: The answer should indicate that the result of calling funcA with 1 is "This is the output of funcA(1)" and that the result of calling funcB with 2 is "This is the output of funcB(2)"

description: Asserts that the model can make a mix of ordered an unordered function calls and conveys the result to the user
prompt: First funcA with 1 and wait for the result, then call funcB with 2, funcC with 3, and funcD with 4 in any order before finally calling funcE with 5, then respond with the result of each call

expected_function_calls.name: funcA
expected_function_calls.result: This is the output of funcA(1)

any_order.name: funcD
any_order.result: This is the output of funcD(4)

any_order.name: funcC
any_order.result: This is the output of funcC(3)

any_order.name: funcB
any_order.result: This is the output of funcB(2)

expected_function_calls.name: funcE
expected_function_calls.result: This is the output of funcE(5)

final_answer_should: The answer should indicate that the result of calling funcA with 1 is "This is the output of funcA(1)", funcB with 2 is "This is the output of funcB(2)", funcC with 3 is "This is the output of funcC(3)", funcD with 4 is "This is the output of funcD(4)", funcE with 5 is "This is the output of funcE(5)"
